item.title: Chapter 2 : Guns
item.description: Lesson 1 Vocabulary Vocabulary sheet with vocabulary about gun violence in the USA Document 1 : Gun Nation Lesson 2 Vocabulary : Expressing numbers and statistics Worsheet with vocabulary and numbers from past years Examples are here : https://www.gunviolencearchive.org/ Vocabulary : Expressing evolutions in numbers Listening (J Jacobs : Gun crime in New York) http://cle.ens-lyon.fr/anglais/civilisation/domaine-americain/problematiques-contemporaines/the-gun-control-debate-in-the-us Lesson 3 Grammar : There is / there are there is / are there was / were there will be there has been there may/might be there might have been Writing Why is gun control so difficult in the USA?

item.title: Chapter 1 : Pirates
item.description: Lesson 1 Trace Ecrite : Pirates fiction vs. reality Fiction Reality They donâ€™t respect any rules or laws They use boats / they sail They have a fake leg or arm or an eye patch They are violent (hurt, kill, steal) They ate feasts and enjoyed abundance. Actually, they were ill and malnourished They drink lots of alcohol Treasure maps The pirate crew attacked other ships The desire to get incredibly rich According to films, women were allowed on the boats.

item.title: Chapter 0 : Summer review
item.description: Lesson 1 Recall what news you remember from the summer Listening with 10 news items from the summer https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pq27q322Anf37GjjwDTPhfg3YNl6LaGl/view?usp=sharing Start preparation for a personal presentation of the news https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1e4fXwvBdbXZNDuMzLjKzQOBuZf0lOqg%5FwRGPhJlkiy8/edit?usp=sharing
